info.name: Caster
info.description: A magic wielder trained to hunt down evil mages.

description.p: Clad in the silver robes that denote her status, an elf closes her eyes to shut out the distractions of the battlefield and begins her quiet chant. Fingers weaving in front of her, she completes her spell and launches a tiny bead of fire toward the enemy ranks, where it erupts into a conflagration that engulfs the soldiers.

Delving deep into meditation, a human finds solace in the wisdom of the universe, emerging from the planes of magic into a state of pure being, raising a token on the battelfield and outlasting his enemies and strenghtening his allies he shines bright like the sun.

Crouching on the floor in a dungeon intersection, a gnome closes her eyes to feel the flow of the multiverse. After a few moments she opens them again, shining bright like stars in the nightsky and turns a stealthy herd of orcs ahead of her into stone.
Pointing his hand in a simple gesture, a loxodon conjures a bright streak of light to diminish a necromancer to fine gray dust.

Casters are supreme magic weilders, empowered trough the positive energy that suffuses the multiverse. Drawing on the subtle weave of magic that permeates the cosmos, casters learn to shape reality to suit their needs. They delve deep into the very foundations of magic, the source of the multiverse itself, to bring balance to all life, becoming pillars of magic themselves in the process.

The wisdom of the multiverse seeks to quench those who thirst for balance and peace and a deeper understanding of themselves and the nature of the multiverse. Unlike Other wizards or magic users, casters directly interact with the cosmic weave that suffuses the multiverse and in essence become pillars to the very fabric of magic itself, Agents of cosmic balance. They let the very river of pure magic flow through them, learning to direct it's current.

Some cultures understood that magic is best battled with magic. Casters feel the balance in the multiverse and strive for cosmic peace, which doesn't always mean conventional peace. Some Casters are Avatars of War, taking their peace to the enemies of cosmic balance. They often seek out evil beings and necromantic powers to reestablish balance in the deep flow of the magic suffusing the multiverse.

Creating a Caster character demands a backstory dominated by at least one extraordinary event. How did your character first come into contact with magic? How did you discover you had an aptitude for? When did you begin to feel the flow suffusing the multiverse and how to interpret it's will?
You can make a caster quickly by following these suggestions. First, Wisdom should be your highest ability score, followed by Constitution or Dexterity. Second, choose the Witch hunter background.
As a caster, you gain the following class features.

Hit Dice:1d6 per caster level
Hit Points at 1st Level:6 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels:1d6 (or 4) + your Constitution modifier per caster level after 1st

Armor:None
Weapons:Daggers, Spears, slings, quarterstaffs, shortbows, shortswords, sickles, handaxes
Tools:None

Saving Throws:Intelligence, Wisdom
Skills:Choose two from Arcana, History, Insight, Investigation, Medicine, and Religion
You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a component pouch or (b) an arcane focus
(a) a shortbow and 20 bolts or (b) any simple weapon
(a) a dungeon delver's pack or (b) an explorer’s pack

description.p: Cantrips are the very start for every mage and even Casters are no exception to that rule. You begin with a certain number of Cantrips and learn more later on.
At 1st level, you gain some 1st-­level Caster spells of your choice, which are, as well as any later added spells fixed in your mind.

The Starlighter table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell’s level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Caster spells. You use Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a caster spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier
You can cast a caster spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.

sheet.description: You use an arcane focus to cast spells and can also cast Caster spells as a ritual.

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 18th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Becoming inured to the flow of the cosmos, you noticed, that you act like a sieve for the current of magic. You redirect a part of the cosmic flow into your body, causing your spells and attacks to deal an additional 1d8 force damage. Since your body contains a maelstrom of magical energy, upon your death fountains of magic erupt from within you, leaving no physical trace of the body except for a sphere of lightly radiating free magic.

sheet.description: Your attacks and spells deal an additional 1d8 force damage.

description.p: As a Caster you meditate deeply inside the river of magic, that suffuses the multiverse, feeling it's current and becoming attuned to it's flow. Moving with the current you get a feeling for perfect timing and are capable of bypassing even the sturdiest defenses or magical barriers. Targets of your spells gain no benefit from advantage against your spells or spell saving throws, regardless of the source of their advantage. Furthermore your attacks and spells that deal force damage ignore resistance and immunity to force damage.

sheet.description: Targets of your spells gain no benefit from advantage against your spells or spell saving throws. Your attacks and spells that deal force damage ignore resistance and immunity to force damae.

description.p: At 6th level, you can forge a magical bond with a weapon or summon a weapon of pure magical energy, that deals 1d8 radiant damage instead of its original damage type and glows with dim light in a 5 feet radius, attacks with it count as magical and you may use this weapon as a spellcasting focus. Choose a weapon with which you are proficient. Performing the bonding ritual takes 1 hour, which may be done during a short rest. The weapon must be within your reach throughout the ritual.

You can’t be disarmed of your bonded weapon as long as you are conscious. If it is on the same plane of existence, you can summon that weapon as a bonus action on your turn, causing it to teleport instantly to your hand. If you attempt to bond to another weapon, you break the bond with the first.

While your bond exists, you can use your spellcasting ability for the attack and damage rolls of attacks using that weapon. The weapon also becomes magical, if it isn’t already. At 10th level, your effectiveness with the weapon improves as it gains a bonus of +1 to attack and damage rolls, and then again to a +2 bonus at 14th level.

description.p: Through decades of training you have become a pillar to the very foundation of magic and a part of the comsic power of the positive plane is now permanently rooted through you. Beginning at 10th level, while you are concentrating on a spell, your concentration can only be broken by you ending the spell or by your death. However you can only concentrate on as many as 2 spells at once.

sheet.description: While you are concentrating on a spell, your concentration can’t be broken. However you can only concentrate on as many as 2 spells at once.

description.p: Starting at 15th level, you have learned to redirect strands of magic from nearby castings into yourself to fuel and empower yourself. Whenenver a spell is cast in a 90ft. radius centered on you, you cast a spell, are subject of a spell, trigger a spell or enter the area effect of a spell, you regain hit points equal to the level of the spell. If doing so would grant you more hit points than you can have, you gain stackable temporary hit points, that do not vanish after long rests, equal to the amount of excess hit points received.

Furthermore you gain a number of weave points equal to half the level of the spell (rounded up). You may store weave points equal to your level. You can consume weave points in order to regain up to a 8th level spell slot, which consumes 2 weave points per spell slot level.
Additionally, you can use your weave points to augment you spells. Chose two metamagic feats, each can be invoked upon a spell by expending weave points.
Whenever you have 5 or more weave points, you may spend them and transform into a being of pure magical energy for 10 minutes (per 5 weave points), gaining the following benefits:
You gain a flying speed of 60 feet.

You become incorporeal and may move through objects. 1 foot of lead blocks this ability. If you are inside an object or a creature at the when your transformation ends, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take 1d10 force damage
You gain resistance to nonmagical piercing, slashing and bludegeoning damage.
You gain advantage on saving throws against spells.
You gain resistance to force damage.
You can invoke metamagic feats for half their price (rounded down)

After decades of training under an Eldritch being of magical power, you became inured to the very fabric of magic itself, learning to pour strands of magic out of the weave effortlessly. So much so that you may cast certain spells without expending spell slots. Choose a 1st-level and a 2nd-­level caster spell, that you know. You can cast those spells at their lowest level without expending a spell slot. If you want to cast either spell at a higher level, you must expend a spell slot as normal.

sheet.description: Choose a 1st-level starlighter spell and a 2nd-­level starlighter spell, that you know. You can cast those spells at their lowest level without expending a spell slot

description.p: Standing in the rivers of the Wevae for so long changed you. Bursting out from deep inside you, you subconsciously protect your physical form from damage creating an Aegis around you, that grants you resistance to the damage of spells.

sheet.description: You gain resistance to the damage of spells.

description.p: When you cast a spell that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, you can protect some of those creatures from the spell’s full force. To do so, you spend 1 sorcery point and choose a number of those creatures up to your Widom modifier (minimum of one creature). A chosen creature automatically succeeds on its saving throw against the spell.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, you can protect some of those creatures from the spell’s full force. To do so, you spend 1 weave point and choose a number of those creatures equal to the weave points spent up to your wisdom modifier. A chosen creature automatically succeeds on its saving throw against the spell.

description.p: When you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, you can spend 3 weave points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

description.p: When you cast a spell, you can spend 1 weave point to cast it without any somatic or verbal components. You can invoke this even if you have already used a different Metamagic option.

description.p: When you cast a spell that deals damage, you may expend a number of weave points equal to the spells level to overcome even the strongest defenses. Your spell ignores resistances and Features such as the Terrasque's Reflective Carrapace Feature and Shield spells of 4th level or lower such as magic armor, shield or barkskin. You can invoke this even if you have already used a different Metamagic option.

On a failed save, the creature is restrained until the end of your next turn. This metamagic cannot be used on spells that already have restraining effects.

Any attack throw for the chosen spell is considered an automatic success due to the successful weapon attack, and any saving throw for the chosen spell is made with disadvantage.
